contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary}} '''Hit and run''' typically refers to [[Hit and run (vehicular)]], the crime of failing to stop and identify oneself after a vehicular collision. '''Hit and run''' may also refer to: ==In business== * [[Hit & Run Music Publishing]], a British music publisher * [[Hit and Run Productions]], a British film company ==In film== * ''Hit and Run'' (1924), starring [[Hoot Gibson]] * [[Hit and Run (1957 film)|''Hit and Run'' (1957 film)]], starring [[Cleo Moore]] * ''Hit and Run'' (1997), starring [[Kari Wührer]] * [[Hit and Run (2009 film)|''Hit and Run'' (2009 film)]], starring [[Laura Breckenridge]] * [[Hit and Run (2012 film)|''Hit and Run'' (2012 film)]], starring [[Dax Shepard]] ==In literature== * [[Hit and Run (novel)|''Hit and Run'' (novel)]], by Lurlene McDaniel * ''Hit and Run'' by [[Lawrence Block]] ==In music== ;Artists * [[Hit and Run (band)]], a bluegrass band from Boulder, Colorado ;Albums * [[Hit & Run (Big Sugar album)|''Hit & Run'' (Big Sugar album)]], 2003 * [[Hit and Run (Girlschool album)|''Hit and Run'' (Girlschool album)]], 1981 * [[Hit and Run (T.S.O.L. album)|''Hit and Run'' (T.S.O.L. album)]], 1987 * [[Hit & Run (EP)|''Hit & Run'' (EP)]], by Sloan, 2009 ;Songs * "Hit and Run" by The Bar-Kays, from ''[[Nightcruising]]'' (1981) * "Hit and Run" by Breathe Carolina, from ''[[Hell Is What You Make It]]'' (2011) * "Hit and Run" by Kim Carnes, from ''[[Mistaken Identity (Kim Carnes album)|Mistaken Identity]]'' (1981) * "Hit 'N' Run" by Skazi, from ''[[Total Anarchy]]'' (2006) * "Hit and Run" by [[Loleatta Holloway]], from ''Loleatta'' (1977) * "Hit and Run" by [[Jo Jo Zep & The Falcons]], from ''Screaming Targets'' (1979) * "Another Hit and Run" by Def Leppard, from ''[[High 'n' Dry]]'' (1981) ==In television== * [[Hit and Run (Modern Family)|"Hit and Run" (''Modern Family)'']], an episode of the series ''Modern Family'' * "Hit and Run", an episode of the series ''Strangers with Candy'' (see [[List of Strangers with Candy episodes#Season 2: 2000]]) * [[Hit & Run (Gladiators)|Hit & Run (''Gladiators)'']], an event within the television show ''Gladiators'' ==Other uses== * [[Hit and run (baseball)]], a baseball play in which runners are in motion before the ball is hit * [[Hit-and-run posting]], on internet forums * [[Hit-and-run tactics]], a military tactical doctrine * ''[[The Simpsons: Hit & Run]]'', a 2003 video game * Hit & Run, a fictional character in the ''G.I. Joe'' franchise (see [[List of G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero characters (H–L)#Hit & Run]]) * Hit & Run, a blog published by the magazine ''[[Reason (magazine)|Reason]]'' {{disambiguation}}
